public final class AccessSet
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Deprecated.
    since EJBCA 6.8.0
    Represents all access rules that a given AuthenticationToken is allowed to access.

    • Field Detail

      • WILDCARD_SOME

        public static final String WILDCARD_SOME
        Deprecated.
        Wildcard meaning: Access is granted to some items. Used only in calls to isAuthorized to query whether we have access to any of the items (and in AccessSet objects for faster access control checks).

        Example: "/cryptotoken/use/*SOME", which would check if we have access to use any cryptotoken.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • fromAccessRules

        public static AccessSet fromAccessRules​(HashMap<String,​Boolean> accessRules,
                                        Set<String> allResources)
        Deprecated.
        Converts from EJBCA 6.8.0+ access rules to the old version of AccessSet introduced in EJBCA 6.6.0, for compatibility with old RA clients. The result of the conversion is written to "set", which is a HashSet of every single accepted resource enriched with "*SOME" but no "*RECURSIVE". Before calling this method, the "accessMap" variable is expected to contain the 6.8.0+ access rule structure. Note: - The legacy set created via this method will not grant access to a configured rules that don't exist on the system. - ...and this means that access to non-existing resources will not be granted to old RA clients.
        Parameters:
        accessRules - the EJBCA 6.8.0+ style access rules
        allResources - whole universe of resources that exists
        Returns:
        an AccessSet of every single accepted resource enriched with "*SOME", but no "*RECURSIVE"
